member.summary:
Specifies the LastKnownGoodConfigurationCacheOptions which can be used to configure the internal LKG configuration cache. See for more details.
All fields/properties are now defined in the Microsoft.IdentityModel.Tokens.Configuration.LKGConfigurationCacheOptions class so they are more accessible from other assemblies/classes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.GetConfigurationAsync
member.summary: Obtains an updated version of Configuration.
member.remarks: If the time since the last call is less than then is not called and the current Configuration is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.GetConfigurationAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Obtains an updated version of Configuration.

remarks.para: If the time since the last call is less than then is not called and the current Configuration is returned. By default, this method blocks until the configuration is retrieved the first time. After the configuration was retrieved once, updates will happen in the background. Failures to retrieve the configuration on the background thread will be logged.

If this operation is configured to be blocking through the switch 'Switch.Microsoft.IdentityModel.UpdateConfigAsBlocking' then this method will block each time the configuration needs to be updated or hasn't been retrieved. If the configuration cannot be initially retrieved an exception will be thrown. If the configuration has been retrieved, but cannot be updated, then the exception will be logged and the current configuration will be returned.

By using the app context switch you choose what works best for you when there is a signing key update: either block requests from being validated until the new key is retrieved, or allow requests to be validated with the current key until the new key is retrieved. If blocking, a service receiving high concurrent request may experience thread starvation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.UpdateCurrentConfigurationAsync
member.summary: This should be called when the configuration needs to be updated either from RequestRefresh or AutomaticRefresh The Caller should first check the state checking state using: if (Interlocked.CompareExchange(ref _configurationRetrieverState, ConfigurationRetrieverRunning, ConfigurationRetrieverIdle) == ConfigurationRetrieverIdle).

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.GetBaseConfigurationAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Obtains an updated version of Configuration.
member.remarks: If the time since the last call is less than then is not called and the current Configuration is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.RequestRefresh
member.summary:
Triggers updating metadata when:
1. Called the first time.
2. The time between when this method was called and DateTimeOffset.Now is greater than .
If == then this method does nothing.
member.remarks: If the strategy is configured to be blocking through the switch 'Switch.Microsoft.IdentityModel.UpdateConfigAsBlocking', then this method will not update the configuration, instead it will request the next call to should request new configuration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.DefaultAutomaticRefreshInterval
member.summary: 12 hours is the default time interval that afterwards, will obtain new configuration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.DefaultRefreshInterval
member.summary: 5 minutes is the default time interval that must pass for to obtain a new configuration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.MinimumAutomaticRefreshInterval
member.summary: 5 minutes is the minimum value for automatic refresh. can not be set less than this value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.ConfigurationManager`1.MinimumRefreshInterval
member.summary: 1 second is the minimum time interval that must pass for to obtain new configuration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.HttpDocumentRetriever.RequireHttps
member.summary: Requires Https secure channel for sending requests.. This is turned ON by default for security reasons. It is RECOMMENDED that you do not allow retrieval from http addresses by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.HttpDocumentRetriever.HttpVersion
member.summary: If set, specifies the desired HTTP version to use for the requests. Otherwise, HttpClient.DefaultRequestVersion is used.
member.remarks: HttpRequestMessage.Version specifies the desired request version. HttpRequestMessage.VersionPolicy defines how strictly the HTTP version should be adhered to, allowing for fallback to other versions if necessary.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.HttpDocumentRetriever.HttpVersionPolicy
member.summary: If set, specifies the protocol version policy to use when sending HTTP requests. Otherwise, HttpClient.DefaultVersionPolicy is used.
member.remarks: HttpRequestMessage.Version specifies the desired request version. HttpRequestMessage.VersionPolicy defines how strictly the HTTP version should be adhered to, allowing for fallback to other versions if necessary.
